section.p: kcaldav is a simple CalDav server depending only on kcgi and libexpat. It implements the minimal subset of a large number of standards, including iCalendar (RFC 5545), CalDav (3744), HTTP (2616), and numerous extensions as detailed in kcaldav(8). The ISO C source code is ISC licensed. It's known to work over simple setups with Mozilla Lightning, Mac OS X iCal, and iOS7 (iPhone4) clients. It compiles and runs on OpenBSD, Linux, and Mac OS X. It is not production ready, so use at your own risk:

ol.li: make install the manpages and CGI, setting PREFIX=/usr/local to the manpage root and CGIPREFIX=/var/www/cgi-bin to the CGI script target.

section.p: To use kcaldav, consult the kcaldav(8) manual. You'll also want to read kcaldav.conf(5) and kcaldav.passwd(5). If it lacks information or clarity, that's a bug. You'll need kcgi and libexpat installed as a compile-time dependencies.
